programme.title: Stadium of Fears
programme.desc: Everyone knows the biggest stadiums in the world. But sometimes its the smallest stadiums that are the most intimidating for players, due to their fans and their fervor. Several big names in football tell you about their experiences in these stadiums where it can sometimes be difficult to play.

programme.title: Olympique Lyonnais vs Manchester United - UEFA Europa League 2024/25 - Quarter Finals 1st Leg
programme.desc: This will be the first season whereby the UEFA Europa League will be played under a new format, which replaces the 32-team group stage with a 36-team league phase. The new format also does not allow teams to transfer from the Champions League knockout stage to the Europa League knockout stage. The final will be played on 21 May 2025 at San Mames stadium in Bilbao, Spain.All matches are live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Salah
programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam.The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Ummah
programme.desc: Ummah is an Arabic word meaning

programme.title: My Faith in Sport -Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab.Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan

programme.title: My Faith in Sport -Takkafur
programme.desc: Islam teaches Muslims about ‘Tawakkul’ meaning trusting in God’s plan. Muslims believe in the idea that with anything in life we put forward our best efforts but ultimately the rest is left to God and believing whatever the outcome, it was pre-written. Omar Marmoush is the feature athlete in the final episode of the series – from the outskirts of the Eintracht Frankfurt side to an $80m move to Premier League Manchester City, his last 18 months has seen an incredible rise. His love of Ramadan and belief that fasting elevates his game is a central theme of the final episode alongside detail of his early life, career and his unfaltering belief in Islam. programme.title: Bundesliga - Special 2024/2025 - Hungry for Success
programme.desc: What do Jamal Musiala, Florian Wirtz, Jude Bellingham, Erling Haaland and Manuel Neuer have in common? They are all children of the Bundesliga, the league where they developed into stars of world format – whether thanks to excellent youth academy work, or equally excellent scouting.In our special report “Hungry for Success – the Bundesliga’s Bright Young Stars” we go behind the scenes at some of Germany’s top clubs. The Bundesliga has a long-established reputation for taking top prospects up to the next level. Every year, in one of the world’s strongest leagues, new stars are born and fresh foundations laid for extraordinary football careers.

programme.title: Burkina Faso vs Zambia - CAF U17 Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025 - Quarter Finals
programme.desc: The 2025 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations is the 15th edition of the biennial African youth football tournament organized by Confederation of African Football (CAF) for players aged 17 and below. Morocco was chosen as the host of this edition The top 10 teams will qualify for the 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup in Qatar as the CAF representatives. It is the first U-17 Africa Cup of Nations to feature 16 teams. Senegal are the defending champions.

programme.title: Uganda vs Gambia - CAF U17 Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025 Play Offs/ Matches de Barrage
programme.desc: The 2025 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations is the 15th edition of the biennial African youth football tournament organized by Confederation of African Football (CAF) for players aged 17 and below. Morocco was chosen as the host of this edition The top 10 teams will qualify for the 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup in Qatar as the CAF representatives. It is the first U-17 Africa Cup of Nations to feature 16 teams. Senegal are the defending champions.

programme.title: Jack DRAPER (GBR) vs Alejandro DAVIDOVICH FOKINA (ESP) - Rolex Monte Carlo Masters - ATP 1000 - Mona
programme.desc: The Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters is a prestigious ATP Masters 1000 clay-court tournament held annually at the Monte Carlo Country Club in Roquebrune-Cap-Martin, France, near Monaco. Celebrating its 118th edition in 2025. As the first of three clay-court Masters 1000 tournaments each season, it attracts the worlds top tennis talent, offering valuable points and prize money. The tournament has seen legendary champions, with Rafael Nadal holding a record 11 titles.

programme.title: Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs Novak Djokovic (SRB) - Final - Miami Open 2025 - presented by Itaú - ATP 1000
programme.desc: 19-year-old Mensik, the Czech phenom, blasts into his first Masters final—taking down Top 10 giants with missile serves and fearless power. One win from history as youngest Miami champ ever.Across the net: Djokovic. The old lion prowls for his 7th Miami throne—still devouring dreamers.Tonight, fire meets fortress. The future charges at forever.

programme.title: A. Kovacevic (USA) vs F. Auger Aliassime (CAN) - Final - Occitanie Open - ATP 250 - Montpellier 202
programme.desc: The 2025 Open Sud de France final in Montpellier sees qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic (USA) take on second seed Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN). Kovacevic, making a stunning run from the qualifiers, aims for his maiden ATP title, while Auger-Aliassime, a former finalist in Montpellier, looks to secure his first trophy of the season. With Kovacevics resilience and Auger-Aliassime’s firepower, the final promises an intense battle for the championship.

programme.title: Aryna Sabalenka vs Madison Keys (USA) - Womens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian Open
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka faces Madison Keys in the Australian Open women’s singles final. Sabalenka, the World No. 1, dominates their head-to-head 4-1 and looks unstoppable on Rod Laver Arena, riding a 20-match winning streak. Keys, ranked 19th, delivers a stunning run, defeating top seeds, including Iga Swiatek, with improved form under her husband-coach Bjorn Fratangelo. A clash of power and precision unfolds as they battle for the title.

programme.title: Day 2 - Triathlon World Tour 2025 - Singapore T100
programme.desc: On Day 2 of the 2025 T100 Triathlon World Tour in Singapore, the mens professional race showcased top-tier talent competing over a 100km course encompassing a 2km swim in Marina Bay, an 80km bike ride over the Benjamin Sheares Bridge, and an 18km run through Gardens by the Bay. The field featured defending T100 champion Marten Van Riel, IRONMAN 70.3 World Champion Jelle Geens, and Olympic medalist Hayden Wilde making his T100 debut.

programme.desc: This will be the first season whereby the UEFA Europa League will be played under a new format, which replaces the 32-team group stage with a 36-team league phase. programme.title: Qualifying - FIA Formula 3 Championship - Bahrain Round
programme.desc: The 2025 FIA Formula 3 Championship is an open-wheel racing category serving as the third tier of formula racing in the FIA Global Pathway. The category will be run in support of selected rounds of the 2025 FIA Formula One World Championship. As the championship is a spec series, all teams and drivers competing in the championship will run the same car, the Dallara F3 2025. Prema Racing are the reigning Teams Champions

programme.title: Qualifying - FIA Formula 2 Championship - Bahrain Round
programme.desc: The 2025 FIA Formula 2 Championship is an open-wheel racing category serving as the second tier of formula racing in the FIA Global Pathway. The category will be run in support of selected rounds of the 2025 Formula One World Championship. As the championship is a spec series, all teams and drivers competing in the championship will run the same car, the new Dallara F2 2024. Invicta Racing are the reigning Teams Champions.

programme.title: Practice 2 - F1 Gulf Air Bahrain Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: In this key evening session, teams shift focus to race simulations under cooler track conditions. programme.title: Slovakia vs Denmark - Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers 2025 - Slovakia - Singles
programme.desc: In Group C of the 2025 Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers, Slovakia hosts Denmark at Peugeot Arena in Bratislava. The Slovak team, featuring experienced players like Viktoria Kužmová and Rebecca Šramková, looks to make home advantage count. Denmark, led by rising star Clara Tauson, brings youth and power to the tie. With only one team progressing to the Finals in Shenzhen, every match in this group holds major stakes.

programme.title: Colombia vs Kazakhstan - Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers 2025 - Australia - Singles
programme.desc: In the 2025 Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers, Colombia competes against Kazakhstan and Australia in Group D, hosted at Brisbanes Pat Rafter Arena. Colombias team is led by Camila Osorio and Emiliana Arango, who recently reached the WTA 500 final in Monterrey. Kazakhstans lineup features top players Elena Rybakina and Yulia Putintseva. The group winner will advance to the Billie Jean King Cup Finals in Shenzhen, China

programme.title: Germany vs Great Britain - Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers 2025 - Netherlands - Singles
programme.desc: In the 2025 Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers, Great Britain faces Germany on April 11 in The Hague. The British team, led by Katie Boulter, takes on a strong German squad featuring Laura Siegemund and Tatjana Maria. With Emma Raducanu absent, Team GB looks to secure a spot in November’s Finals through a one-day indoor clay court showdown.

programme.title: Romania vs Canada - Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers 2025 - Japan - Singles
programme.desc: In the 2025 Billie Jean King Cup Qualifiers, Romania takes on Canada in Group A, held at Tokyos Ariake Coliseum. Romania is led by veterans like Ana Bogdan and rising star Jaqueline Cristian, while Canada fields a strong team featuring Leylah Fernandez and Marina Stakusic, both coming off strong WTA performances. With only one spot available for the Finals in Shenzhen, this clash is set to be one of the most competitive in the group stage.

programme.title: Archery World Cup 2024 Review EP 2
programme.desc: we recap the 2024 Hyundai Archery World Cup season as the worlds best compound archers take to arenas around the world. In this all-important Olympic season, we recap the best of the best on the World Cup tour.

programme.title: Chartres vs PSG - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Toulouse vs Cesson - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. programme.title: World Sailing Show 2025
programme.desc: The World Sailing Show 2025 brings you the most thrilling moments from elite sailing competitions around the globe. From high-speed foiling action to tactical offshore battles, this episode covers top events like the America’s Cup, SailGP, and The Ocean Race. Meet the world’s best sailors, explore cutting-edge boat technology, and witness the drama of high-stakes racing on the water.

programme.title: Main Race - Seville Marathon 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 Zurich Maraton de Sevilla is set to celebrate its 40th anniversary on Sunday, February 23 in Seville, Spain. Renowned for its flat and fast course, the event has become a favorite among elite and amateur runners alike.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2025
programme.desc: This is a show that introduces you to the personalities of the exciting world of outdoor sports and takes you to the best events. We are convinced that some of the many diverse pathways we take in life must be dirt paths because filling our lives with adventure offers us some amazing stories to tell, and this is what the outdoor sports show will provide for you!

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2025
programme.desc: This is a show that introduces you to the personalities of the exciting world of outdoor sports and takes you to the best events. We are convinced that some of the many diverse pathways we take in life must be dirt paths because filling our lives with adventure offers us some amazing stories to tell, and this is what the outdoor sports show will provide for you!

programme.title: Limoges vs Nantes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Main Race - Seville Marathon 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 Zurich Maraton de Sevilla is set to celebrate its 40th anniversary on Sunday, February 23 in Seville, Spain. Renowned for its flat and fast course, the event has become a favorite among elite and amateur runners alike.

programme.title: World Sailing Show 2025
programme.desc: The World Sailing Show 2025 brings you the most thrilling moments from elite sailing competitions around the globe. From high-speed foiling action to tactical offshore battles, this episode covers top events like the America’s Cup, SailGP, and The Ocean Race.
